title: Which chords can I play pentatonic over? - Quora

response.answer_text: Scale A C D E G : Am , Am7 , Am7/add11 , A7/sus4, , Csus2 /A , Am/add4; ADG , DGC , EAD and inversions; ADGC , CEAD , DGCE , EADG and inversions Scale C D E G A : C/add2(add9) , C6 , C6/add2 , C6/sus2 ; CEAD , DGCE ,EADG , GCDA ; GDEA , ADGC ; CEADG , DGACE , EADGC , GCEAD , ADGCE This is only part of the possibilities. All inversions are possible if they sound good. Coltrane-style modal jazz also uses a dominant seventh , but only one type of X7 / # 9 ; in these examples E7/#9 for A pentatonic and G7/#9 for C pent ( in both chords the fifth is avoided ).
You can play any note over any chord. Ask more specific questions.
